intro: Gynochthodes costata, commonly known as the coastal thornbush, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its adaptations to coastal environments include salt tolerance and resistance to strong winds. Gynochthodes costata plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for local wildlife.
